a.span: Annual Notifications for Parents and Students

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.h1: COVID-19 School Closure/Cierre de la Escuela

div.span: Santa Clara County has made the decision to close all schools through the end of the school year, as a preventative measure to stop the spread of COVID19.

div.div: We recognize that this is an unprecedented time and recognize that this may impact your family. We continue to be committed to your child’s education and growth during this trying time and will be sending ongoing communications and resources.

div.strong: If you haven't already done so, please update your contact information by filling in this form at https://permission.click/AYbVz/us so that you will receive up to date communications from the district and your child's school.

div.div: The leadership team in Sunnyvale has prioritized developing plans in the following two areas to support your child/ren and family:
• Five sites will be open for a free combined breakfast, lunch, and dinner pick up (not for onsite eating).
• Please help us to encourage families to come by Bishop, Lakewood, San Miguel, Vargas, or Columbia Middle.
• Hours are Monday-Friday from 11-1 p.m.

• The District strongly encourages all families to have their child(ren) participate in the assigned lessons and classroom activities. Instruction will be for the purpose of moving students’ learning forward and although feedback will be provided, the assignments will not be graded.
• Regularly scheduled assessments, including State Testing (CAASPP), and ELPAC (English Language Proficiency Assessment for California) will not be administered during this time.
• If you need devices and Internet access please email covid19concerns@sesd.org or call 408-522-8200 ext. 1107.
Check out our optional Spring Break adventure put together by our very own Educational Services Department here: bit.ly/SESDspringbreak

El condado de Santa Clara tomó la decisión de cerrar todas las escuelas hasta el final del año escolar como medida preventiva para detener la propagación de COVID19. Reconocemos que este es un momento sin precedentes y reconocemos que esto puede afectar a su familia. Continuamos comprometidos con la educación y el crecimiento de su hijo durante este período de prueba y enviaremos comunicaciones y recursos continuos.

strong.span: Si aún no lo ha hecho, actualice su información de contacto completando este formulario en
para que reciba comunicaciones actualizadas del distrito y la escuela de su hijo.

div.div: El equipo de liderazgo del Distrito de Sunnyvale ha priorizado desarrollar planes concretos en las siguientes dos áreas para apoyar a su estudiante y su familia.

• SSD está trabajando en la apertura de 5 sitios escolares para proveer desayuno, almuerzo, y la cena gratis a nuestras familias. El servicio de desayuno y almuerzo comenzara lunes 16 de marzo. Este servicio será continuo de lunes a viernes de las 11 am a 1 pm.
• Las cinco escuelas que estarán abiertas ofreciendo el servicio de alimentos son Bishop, Lakewood, San Miguel, Vargas, y Columbia Middle School.
• Horario: lunes a viernes 11-1pm

• El Distrito alienta encarecidamente a todas las familias a que sus hijos participen en las lecciones asignadas y las actividades del aula. La instrucción tendrá el propósito de hacer avanzar el aprendizaje de los estudiantes y, aunque se proporcionarán comentarios, las tareas no serán calificadas.
• Las evaluaciones programadas regularmente, incluidas las Pruebas estatales (CAASPP) y ELPAC (Evaluación de dominio del idioma inglés para California) no se administrarán durante este tiempo.
• Si necesita dispositivos y acceso a Internet, envíe un correo electrónico a covid19concerns@sesd.org o llame al 408-522-8200 ext. 1107.

strong.a: Formulario de solicitud de soporte técnico para padres/tutores/estudiantes

div.span: Echa un vistazo a nuestra aventura opcional de vacaciones de primavera organizada por nuestro propio Departamento de Servicios Educativos aquí:

div.p: The CDC and state and local public health departments are continuing to closely monitor new developments regarding the Novel Coronavirus outbreak.

a.title: Go to comments for CORONAVIRUS INFORMATION

div.p: Key topics include: Appointment of Superintendent

div.p: Key topics include: Specifically Designating Public Works Project(s) As Essential Government Functions

div.p: Elementary science and reading language arts proposed instructional materials are available for review online.

div.p: Key topics include: public hearings for increasing developer fees, adoption of grades 4-5 English and Language Arts curriculum, adoption of grades K-5 Mystery Science curriculum and approval of MOU with CSEA

div.p: Key topics include: Employee appointment/discussion regarding the superintendent

img.alt: typewriter special message from the superintendent

div.p: Please check this webpage for ongoing updates and important announcements regarding this process.

a.title: Go to comments for Superintendent Search Webpage

img.alt: green learn today lead tomorrow seedling logo

a.span: December Message: Helping all children become enthusiastic proponents of their own learning journeys

div.p: I think being an educator is the best job in the world. We have the rare honor of helping children develop from curious school newcomers to confident, sophisticated learners.

a.title: Go to comments for December Message: Helping all children become enthusiastic proponents of their own learning journeys

a.span: September Message: The power of story

div.p: Children need to know that their stories have value, just as they themselves are innately and immeasurably valuable.

a.title: Go to comments for September Message: The power of story

div.p: It has been an honor and joy to serve this district, students, and families, for all of these many years.

a.title: Go to comments for Retirement Message

TK-5 Early Dismissal - Teacher Learning Day
